metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 19 axioms covering the basic structure of persons as agents with bodies and minds, perception, and voluntary control
metadata.notation: First-order logic with composite entities, spatial systems, and mind-body integration

axioms.title: Person is Agent
axioms.english: A person is a kind of agent.

axioms.title: Person is Physical Object
axioms.english: A person is also a kind of physical object.

axioms.title: Person Has Body and Mind
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (person p) (exists (b m)(and (body b p)(mind m p)))))
axioms.english: A person has a body and a mind.

axioms.title: Mind is Composite Entity
axioms.english: A mind is a composite entity, allowing us to talk about entities external to the mind.

axioms.title: Body is Physical Object
axioms.english: A body is a physical object.

axioms.title: Body is Spatial System
axioms.fol: (forall (b p) (if (body b p) (and (spatialSystem b) (exists (s) (and (componentsOf s b) (forall (x) (iff (member x s)(bodyPart x p))))))))
axioms.english: A body is a spatial system whose components are body parts, since all body parts are physical objects.

axioms.title: Body Parts Set Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (p s) (iff (bodyPartsOf s p) (exists (b) (and (person p)(body b p)(componentsOf s b)))))
axioms.english: A person p has a set of body parts, namely, the components of the body.

axioms.title: Perceive Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (a x m) (if (and (perceive a x)(mind m a)) (and (agent a)(externalTo x m))))
axioms.english: Perception is a relation between an agent and an entity or eventuality external to the mind.

axioms.title: Nearness Enables Perception
axioms.fol: (forall (p x e2) (if (perceive' e2 p x) (exists (e1 s) (and (near' e1 x p s)(enable e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Something being near a person is an enabling condition for perceiving it.

axioms.title: Sense Organs Subset
axioms.fol: (forall (p x) (if (and (person p)(bodyPartsOf s1 p)) (exists (s2) (and (subset s2 s1) (forall (o) (iff (member o s2)(senseOrgan o p)))))))
axioms.english: The sense organs are a subset of the body parts.

axioms.title: Sense Organ is Body Part
axioms.english: It follows that sense organs are body parts.

axioms.title: Intact Sense Organ Enables Perception
axioms.fol: (forall (p x e2) (if (and (person p)(perceive' e2 p x)) (exists (o e1) (and (senseOrgan o p)(intact' e1 o)(enable e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: When something is perceived, there is a sense organ whose intact-ness enables the perception.

axioms.title: Voluntary Body Part Control
axioms.fol: (forall (p s1) (if (and (person p)(bodyPartsOf s1 p)) (exists (s2) (and (subset s2 s1) (forall (x) (if (member x s2) (exists (e1 e2 y z) (and (move' e2 x y z)(will' e1 p e2) (dcause e1 e2)))))))))
axioms.english: A subset of body parts can be directly controlled by a person's will - the person's willing an event is the direct cause of the motion of the body part.

axioms.title: Voluntary Arm Lifting Example
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (person p) (exists (e1 e2 x) (and (lift' e2 p x)(arm x p)(will' e1 p e2) (dcause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Example: a person can voluntarily lift his or her arm - the lifting is directly caused by willing it.

conversion_notes.mind_body_dualism: Chapter establishes mind-body structure without committing to specific dualist or materialist position
conversion_notes.composite_entity_integration: Both bodies and minds treated as composite entities, enabling internal structure analysis
conversion_notes.spatial_system_body: Bodies are spatial systems with body parts as components, integrating with Chapter 18
conversion_notes.enabling_conditions: Perception requires both nearness and intact sense organs as enabling conditions
conversion_notes.voluntary_control: Distinguishes directly controllable body parts from indirectly controllable ones
conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Uses perceive', near', intact', will', move', lift' for event reification
conversion_notes.cross_references: References predicates from Chapters 15 (agent, enable, dcause), 18 (physobj, spatialSystem), 10 (compositeEntity)
conversion_notes.future_references: References intact (Ch 28) and will (Ch 31) predicates to be explicated later

file_format_notes.section_organization: Three main areas: basic structure, perception, and voluntary control
file_format_notes.complexity_justification: Complex axiom involves multiple nested quantifiers and sophisticated logical structure
file_format_notes.pattern_categorization: Focus on type constraints, definitions, and enabling conditions for person-specific capabilities
file_format_notes.predicate_summary: Chapter introduces 7 new predicates for person structure and capabilities, plus 2 illustrative predicates
